title: Complete the Phrase
description: Fill in the missing word from well-known phrases, clichés, and expressions — how many can you complete?

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Break a ___"
questions.explanation: "Break a leg" is a common way to wish someone good luck, especially in theater.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Bite the ___"
questions.explanation: "Bite the bullet" means to endure a painful or difficult situation with courage.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Hit the nail on the ___"
questions.explanation: "Hit the nail on the head" means to describe exactly what is causing a situation or problem.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "A penny for your ___"
questions.explanation: "A penny for your thoughts" is a way of asking someone what they are thinking about.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Let the cat out of the ___"
questions.explanation: "Let the cat out of the bag" means to accidentally reveal a secret.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Burning the midnight ___"
questions.explanation: "Burning the midnight oil" means staying up very late to work or study.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "The ball is in your ___"
questions.explanation: "The ball is in your court" means it is your turn to take action or make a decision.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Barking up the wrong ___"
questions.explanation: "Barking up the wrong tree" means to pursue a mistaken or misguided course of action.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Don't put all your eggs in one ___"
questions.explanation: "Don't put all your eggs in one basket" means to avoid risking everything on a single venture.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "A blessing in ___"
questions.explanation: "A blessing in disguise" refers to something that seems bad at first but turns out to be good.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Burning your ___ at both ends"
questions.explanation: "Burning your candle at both ends" means exhausting yourself by doing too much, especially staying up late and getting up early.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "A storm in a ___"
questions.explanation: "A storm in a teacup" means making a big fuss over a trivial matter.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Run it up the ___"
questions.explanation: "Run it up the flagpole" means to test an idea by presenting it to others for their reactions.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Read the riot ___"
questions.explanation: "Read the riot act" means to give someone a severe warning or reprimand about their behavior.

questions.question: Complete the phrase: "Turn over a new ___"
questions.explanation: "Turn over a new leaf" means to make a fresh start or change one's behavior for the better.
